comments.body: While agree to most of the changes this one has very dubious value IMO. It certainly does not improve readability.
you mean "no_log=True"? This was already used before and prevents secrets being logged.

No I mean this whole chunk of the diff. Unfortunately github is not really clever in displaying this. My opinion is that aligning the = makes the code much more readable than strict adherence to PEP8.

Maybe we should be more verbose about the interaction of I(name) and I(uuid) here. If I understand the intention correctly the following happens:
- If name and uuid are given and the name of the server with this uuid does not match the name parameter, the server is renamed.
- If multiple servers with the same name as the name parameter exist and no uuid is given, the execution is aborted.
- In all other cases either name or uuid can be used as keys to select an existing server.

Is this correct?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +26,30 @@  - If no I(uuid) option is provided, I(name) is used for server selection. If more than one server with this name exists, execution is aborted.
  - Only the I(name) and I(flavor) are evaluated for the update.
  - The option I(force=true) must be given to allow the reboot of existing running servers for applying the changes.
